title: I am worried for my safety? help please?
body: Last night, at about this time I played a Jayce game, and I won. There was an extremely salty Taliyah on the other team, and she posted a link in the after game chat. I clicked on it because I didn't know she was that mad, It was a big mistake however.. When I clicked it I got an image on my screen that said "now I know your IP" and my ip adress was displayed to me on the screen. What should I do that this person now has my IP? Today he added me, I was kinda worried about what he was gonna do, so I accepted then he posted my IP adress and kept sending it to me over and over again. Telling me he was gonna post it on 4chan and he kept repeating stuff like "youre terrified right now, arent you?" And he said "It wont be a nice day for you." Can anyone help me?

replies.body: Just as others have suggested, I'd strongly urge you to shoot us a ticket with any screenshots of those messages you may have gotten. We can definitely look into it because that's really not cool to have other people possibly harassing you like that. Shoot us a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new), and make sure to give as much relevant information (like screenshots of chat logs) as you can!
You should probably send a ticket to riot for further security
You're right I should. Too bad I cant send them the dms. He blocked me after the messages and I closed league because I was scared. The guy was nuts.

> [{quoted}](name=xZed Pool,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=Y2NupNH3,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2017-05-11T03:29:29.048+0000)
>
> You're right I should. Too bad I cant send them the dms. He blocked me after the messages and I closed league because I was scared. The guy was nuts.

Riot will have logs of everything posted to you. Send them a ticket regardless and let them know what happened. 10 out of 10 this player will either be punished severely or given one hell of a warning for this action.

they probably punked you into going to a shit site that just has the text "now I know your IP" and then it just displays your IP because when you connect to a website, they all know your ip because that's how the internet works, your IP is public to all sites that you connect to, no real surprise there.

you can still submit a ticket though I think as that could technically fall as harassment which is not cool.
Thanks for the relief. I am not the best tech savvy but the stuff he was messaging me sounded so suspicious and menacing that It made me worried haha.

There are still a handful of other things you'd need outside of an IP to really do anything as mentioned above. However, if that isn't fully comforting enough for you,  If you have browser logs of connection activity you can look back over, you can see if anything was downloaded when you went to the sight as well as who/what/where your connection was to (look for address forwarding etc to sketchy domains and IPs in the private domain), and if you were to compare those with any changes in registry/system files at/around the same time, then it may be a slightly more worrisome incident. The likelihood of some troll doing that is a bit slim for game-rage, but not out of the question.
